## 1. Summary:
The discussion primarily focused on performance optimization in Valiant applications. Developers shared experiences about UI rendering performance, particularly how redrawing UI elements impacts CPU/GPU usage. Ashxn mentioned that UI is drawn optimally with batched changes, but complete redraws each frame cause performance issues. Gh0sTt demonstrated this with an RGB keyboard effect that dropped FPS to 40. There was debate about whether browser tabs outside the world affect in-world performance stats, with mixed experiences reported. Ashxn pushed a feature allowing visitors to equip custom avatars. The developers also discussed a chess-related UI implementation and its performance implications. Gh0sTt shared a development philosophy: "1. make it work. 2. make it work for production. 3. make it optimized," which Ashxn endorsed as good practice, noting many developers stop after the first step.

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around users exploring and sharing Hyperfy v2 functionality, particularly focusing on apps (.hyp files) and their implementation. SWISS, a v1 user, is navigating the transition to v2 and discovering how to build out their world. Key technical discussions include file size limitations (30MB models, 12MB persistent limit despite environment variable changes), app discovery and installation (drag-and-drop functionality), and networked vs. local objects. Users share resources including YouTube tutorials, GitHub repositories of .hyp apps, and the playworld environment (play.hyperfy.xyz) where users can discover and download apps. The emote wheel functionality is highlighted as a significant feature, with Ashxn mentioning plans to add it to the core "+" menu. The conversation demonstrates the community-driven nature of app sharing and discovery, with users helping each other understand how to find, implement, and use various apps in the Hyperfy ecosystem.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Where can I find apps for v2? (asked by SWISS) A: Check #marketplace channel, playworld environment, and GitHub repositories (answered by MetaRick, Gert-Jan Akerboom)
Q: What is "networked"? (asked by SWISS) A: It means everyone in world sees the change, while local means only you would see the change happen (answered by MetaRick)
Q: How do you install apps? (implied by SWISS) A: Drag and drop apps into the browser (answered by SWISS, confirmed through experience)
Q: Why can't I drop my 30MB model despite increasing environment variable from 12MB to 50MB? (asked by SWISS) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: MetaRick | Helpee: SWISS | Context: Finding apps for Hyperfy v2 | Resolution: Directed to #marketplace channel and play.hyperfy.xyz where apps can be discovered and downloaded
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: SWISS | Context: Sharing additional app resources | Resolution: Provided GitHub repository with .hyp apps
Helper: MetaRick | Helpee: SWISS | Context: Understanding "networked" functionality | Resolution: Explained that networked means everyone sees changes while local changes are only visible to the user
Helper: fractilians | Helpee: Community | Context: Sharing educational content | Resolution: Shared YouTube tutorial on Emotes walkthrough

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Fix persistent 12MB file size limit despite environment variable changes | Description: User unable to use 13.5MB VRM avatar despite setting 50MB limit | Mentioned By: SWISS
Feature: Add emote wheel to the core "+" menu | Description: Make emote wheel more accessible as a core feature | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Documentation: Create better documentation for app installation | Description: User noted lack of documentation on how to install apps | Mentioned By: SWISS
Feature: Create a comprehensive directory of available apps | Description: Better organization of available apps for easier discovery | Mentioned By: SWISS
Technical: Improve app marketplace with better management | Description: Add ability for creators to manage their apps in the marketplace | Mentioned By: HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host
